title: How to Make Butternut Squash Puree

steps.headline: Cut the squash in half using a strong knife.
steps.description: Remove the seeds, peel, and dice into even-sized pieces.

steps.headline: Boil the squash in a saucepan filled about halfway with water.
steps.description: Bring the water back to a boil after the squash has been added. Simmer for about 8 to 10 minutes or until the squash is soft. Remove the pan from the heat and drain the water.

steps.headline: Use a fork to mash the squash with some unsalted butter.
Cut the squash in half using a strong knife.
steps.description: Remove the seeds with a spoon.

steps.headline: Bake the squash in the oven at 380°F (190°C) for about 1 hour until browned, for a more intense and caramelized flavor.
Using a spoon, scoop squash in a food processor and process until smooth.
steps.description: You can add salt to taste and 1 teaspoon brown sugar (optional).

text: Boiling Cut the squash in half using a strong knife. Remove the seeds, peel, and dice into even-sized pieces. Boil the squash in a saucepan filled about halfway with water. Bring the water back to a boil after the squash has been added. Simmer for about 8 to 10 minutes or until the squash is soft. Remove the pan from the heat and drain the water. Use a fork to mash the squash with some unsalted butter.  Finished.  Baking Cut the squash in half using a strong knife. Remove the seeds with a spoon. Bake the squash in the oven at 380°F (190°C) for about 1 hour until browned, for a more intense and caramelized flavor.  Using a spoon, scoop squash in a food processor and process until smooth. You can add salt to taste and 1 teaspoon brown sugar (optional). Finished.
